    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
A prescription drug that’s been taken by more
  than 6 million people has been linked to a significantly higher risk of heart
  attack – and even death. Wyatt Andrews will report on the new analysis
  of Avandia and our medical correspondent Dr. Jon LaPook will explain what this
  news means to families who deal with type 2 diabetes.
 
In other medical news, a new pill is promising birth
  control with a boost. It could be relief for women from the pains and
  inconveniences of their menstrual cycles. It is due to debut tomorrow but as
  Michelle Miller will report, but its long-term safety isn’t clear.
 
Gas prices have broken the record for high prices
  set during the energy crisis of the early 1980s – when they are
  adjusted for inflation – until now. Anthony Mason will report on how
  tight refinery capacity is the latest cause of high prices at the pump and
  Byron Pitts will have the story of how gasoline costs are affecting
  consumers.
 
Tension in the Middle East can be another factor in
  high gas prices and over the past two days violent urban warfare has erupted
  in Lebanon.
  Intense fighting between Lebanese troops and Islamic militants suspected of
  having ties to al Qaeda has killed dozens of people. Mark Phillips will have
  the story.
 
Some great citizens of the country are being lauded
  for their valor in the wake of Hurricane Katrina. Today one relatively
  unknown name is being added to the list of John F. Kennedy “Profile in
  Courage Award” recipients, which includes the likes of Kofi Annan and
  Gerald Ford. Her name is Doris Voitier. Haven’t heard of her? Correspondent
  Kelly Cobiella will introduce you to this special woman tonight.
 
I hope you’ll join us.
 




Katie Couric
